job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Morehead City, NC
pros: - Directors are oriented in creating a safe and pleasant space for patients and employees. - Department change opportunities to see what part of the healthcare world will suite you. - Clean environment, and follow sterile processing policy well.
cons: - Middle management is horrible, they are not understanding when it comes to doctors appointments or therapy appointments. -They do not respect mental health. - Favoritism - Middle management keeps employees who drive away new candidates and make it harder for other employees to work. - They hardly follow policy of the Mayo clinic or hospital policy.

review_title: A community hospital with heart, by the sea.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Morehead City, NC
pros: Excellent team all around…through all the challenges during Covid, especially in the ER, we continue to see increased pay/ compensation….year end bonus graded according to performance review so it literally pays to be a high performer.   Management that listens and takes great interest in the employees.   Employee recognition consistently provided by management.  Accommodating to help staff deal with life’s stresses, offering support like no where I’ve worked before.    Safety is a key principle in everything they do.  Administration refers to everyone as family….rare in a larger health system.  Staff engagement is strongly encouraged and welcomed.  Patients say they have been treated so well at CarteretHealth, they would rather come to this facility bypassing other hospitals.  That is a true testament to quality and great to hear positive comments in real time.
cons: Lack of some medical practices in the community…specialty care like GI doctors, Neurology, cardiac surgery….so have to transfer some people out…not really a con for the hospital as an employer.  The hospital has incorporated many innovative ways to make those services available to patients…telemedicine and it’s affiliation with the Mayo Clinic.
